name: Vanguard Canadian Ultra-Short Government Bond Index ETF
longDescription: In order to achieve its investment objective, Vanguard Canadian Ultra-Short Government Bond Index ETF employs a passive management - or indexing - investment approach designed to track the performance of the Bloomberg Canadian Short Treasury 1-12M Float Adjusted Index. Vanguard Canadian Ultra-Short Government Bond Index ETF invests by sampling the Bloomberg Canadian Short Treasury 1-12M Float Adjusted Index, meaning that it holds a broadly diversified subset of Constituent Securities and/or other securities selected by the Sub-advisor that, in the aggregate, approximates the full Index in terms of primary risk factors and other key index characteristics.
fulldescription: In order to achieve its investment objective, Vanguard Canadian Ultra-Short Government Bond Index ETF employs a passive management - or indexing - investment approach designed to track the performance of the Bloomberg Canadian Short Treasury 1-12M Float Adjusted Index. Vanguard Canadian Ultra-Short Government Bond Index ETF invests by sampling the Bloomberg Canadian Short Treasury 1-12M Float Adjusted Index, meaning that it holds a broadly diversified subset of Constituent Securities and/or other securities selected by the Sub-advisor that, in the aggregate, approximates the full Index in terms of primary risk factors and other key index characteristics. The Subadvisor matches Vanguard Canadian Ultra-Short Government Bond Index ETFs portfolio investments to the primary risk factors of the Bloomberg Canadian Short Treasury 1-12M Float Adjusted Index, including duration, yield, quality, sector distribution and issue exposure, and seeks to achieve returns that are similar to the applicable Index. This sampling technique is beneficial to Vanguard Canadian Ultra-Short Government Bond Index ETF, as it is designed to reduce trading costs and avoid having to trade illiquid securities that may be included in the Bloomberg Canadian Short Treasury 1-12M Float Adjusted Index The fund seeks to track, to the extent reasonably possible and before fees and expenses, the performance of a Canadian Treasury Bills and Bonds index with an ultrashortterm dollarweighted average maturity
